subject: Medicine
title: Neuroplasticity
description: A short lesson to help you apply Neuroplasticity.

hook.text: London taxi drivers have larger hippocampi than bus drivers. Their brains physically changed from navigating.

buildup.text: Neuroplasticity is the brain's ability to reorganize itself by forming new connections throughout life.

discovery.text: Every time you learn something, synapses strengthen. Unused connections weaken and get pruned away.

twist.text: After a stroke, the brain can rewire around damaged areasâ€”if rehabilitation starts early enough.

climax.text: Plasticity means the brain is never fixed. Practice, learning, and experience literally reshape it.

punchline.text: Your brain is a sculpture shaped by experience.

quiz.question: What did studies of London taxi drivers reveal about the brain?
options: Navigation training physically enlarged part of their brain
Their brains were identical to bus drivers' brains
Driving reduced their overall brain volume
